description: Tech investors including Sacks, Palihapitiya and Leone are throwing their support behind the former president.
title: San Francisco Fetes Trump on Post-Conviction Fundraising Tour

description: The International Monetary Fund and Egypt reached a preliminary agreement that should help unlock the next disbursement of the North African nation’s $8 billion loan.
title: IMF and Egypt Reach Initial Deal for $820 Million Disbursement

description: Keir Starmer’s Labour Party plans to provide mortgage guarantees to first-time buyers in a bid to help young Britons get onto the housing ladder if it wins next month’s general election.
title: Labour Plans Mortgage Guarantees to Help First-Time Buyers

description: Rishi Sunak’s Conservatives are pledging to raise the threshold at which parents lose access to child-care benefits, in their latest effort to shift opinion polls that continue to show the opposition Labour Party is set to win the UK general election.
title: Sunak Pledges Tax Cut for Parents in Next Move to Close UK Polls

description: New Jersey’s former attorney general Gurbir Grewal told a federal jury that Senator Robert Menendez twice reached out to him to complain about how the state’s insurance fraud office was unfairly treating Hispanic defendants.
title: Bob Menendez Meeting With New Jersey AG Was ‘Gross,’ Jury Told

description: The top leadership structure of South Africa’s African National Congress said it will seek to form a government of national unity with opposition groups after last week’s election failed to produce an outright winner.
title: Top ANC Leaders’ Panel Backs South Africa Unity Government Talks

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economics enterprise reporter Rich Miller previews tomorrow’s jobs report and looks behind the numbers. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Parsing the Jobs Numbers for Signs of a Soft Landing for the Economy

description: The longtime head of the Federalist Society, the influential US conservative legal organization, is preparing to step down and has started searching for his successor, according to an email obtained by Bloomberg News.
title: Federalist Society Head Tells Group He’s Searching for Successor

description: A coalition of left-wing parties won the most Dutch seats in the European Parliament elections, in a setback to Geert Wilders’ nascent governing coalition, even as the conservative populist notched significant gains.
title: Wilders Notches Gains in Dutch Vote But Short of Predicted Surge

description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro’s government is freezing budgets for state agencies and public institutions amid constraints from weak tax revenue.
title: Weak Tax Revenue Forces Colombia to Impose State Spending Freeze

description: President Emmanuel Macron said France will send fighter jets to Ukraine and train thousands of soldiers to help the country repel Russia’s invasion.
title: Macron Pledges to Send Fighter Jets and Train Troops for Ukraine

description: New York lawmakers are considering raising taxes on New York City businesses to help plug a $1 billion-a-year hole created by Governor Kathy Hochul’s surprise decision to halt a congestion pricing plan that would have funded vital transit infrastructure improvements.
title: NY Lawmakers Weigh Business Tax Hike After Hochul Toll Reversal

description: Labour is holding a crunch meeting at a secret location on Friday to hammer out the final details of its election manifesto, with a potential row brewing with unions over its promises on worker’s rights.
title: Labour Plans Crunch Meeting Friday to Finalize UK Election Offer

description: Argentine President Javier Milei has canceled a trip to Italy for next week’s Group of Seven summit and backed out of a scheduled meeting with France’s Emmanuel Macron, according to people with knowledge of his plans.
title: Milei Cancels G-7, Macron Visits as Reforms Face Hurdles at Home

description: Poland’s foreign ministry summoned the Belarusian envoy in Warsaw over the death of a soldier who was stabbed by a migrant trying to cross the border illegally.
title: Poland Summons Belarus Envoy Over Soldier’s Murder Near Border

description: Two former UK judges resigned from Hong Kong’s top court as the city continues a national security crackdown that has silenced dissent in the former British colony.
title: Hong Kong Court Sees Two UK Judges Resign Amid Political Tension

description: George Santos, the former US congressman facing criminal charges, asked the judge in his case for permission to travel to the Poconos this summer.
title: George Santos Seeks Permission to Visit the Poconos This Summer

description: Iran accused Germany, France and the UK of escalating tensions by threatening a possible revocation of some sanctions relief that was granted under a 2015 nuclear deal.
title: Iran Accuses West of ‘Misleading’ Concerns Over Nuclear Weapons

description: Hunter Biden’s former lover testified during his gun trial that she regularly begged him to go into treatment for crack cocaine and alcohol addiction, but that he kept “running away like a child.”
title: Hunter Biden Admitted to Lover He Was a ‘Drunk and an Addict’

description: Steve Bannon, a longtime adviser to former President Donald Trump, was ordered to start serving a four-month jail sentence by July 1 for contempt of Congress after his appeal of a 2022 conviction failed.
title: Steve Bannon Ordered to Jail by July as He Fights Contempt Conviction

description: South Carolina Senator Tim Scott, a top contender to be Donald Trump’s running mate, is on a public tour to show his potential boss what he can bring to the Republican presidential ticket: Black voters and billionaire donors.
title: Senator Tim Scott to Spend $14 Million Wooing Black Voters for Trump

description: President Joe Biden said he had ruled out a pardon for his son, Hunter, if he is convicted on federal criminal charges and would respect the verdict, addressing a legal case that threatens to hang over his reelection bid against Donald Trump.
title: Biden Rules Out Pardon for Son Hunter and Will Respect Verdict

description: Hi there, welcome to The Readout. Until the general election on July 4, The Readout will be co-written by Allegra Stratton and Ailbhe Rea alongside other colleagues from the newsroom, giving you extra perspective and analysis as the campaigns unfurl.
title: Julian Harris and Allegra Stratton: Wealth and Taxes

description: Since a new war broke out between Israel and the militant Palestinian group Hamas on Oct. 7, the Lebanese militia Hezbollah has expressed solidarity with Hamas through military action. It has fired missiles, mortars, rockets and explosive drones into northern Israel almost daily, prompting Israel to respond with its own fire. An escalation of the fighting appeared to edge the two sides closer to all-out war in early June. Israel’s military chief of staff Herzi Halevi said his country was approac
title: What Is Hezbollah’s Role in the Israel-Hamas War?

description: Electricity bills will soar this month for most Argentine households heading into a particularly harsh winter as President Javier Milei marches on with economic shock therapy.
title: Milei Begins to Slash Energy Subsidies for Low-Income Argentines

description: The two US antitrust agencies have agreed to divide responsibility over the artificial intelligence industry, giving the Federal Trade Commission the go-ahead to open a probe into Microsoft Corp.’s relationship with OpenAI, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Microsoft, Nvidia to Face US Antitrust Probes Over Moves in AI

description: Early Monday morning, one of the world’s most profitable currency trades unraveled, done in by a twist in Mexican elections few saw coming. Twenty hours later, investors in India started frantically dumping stocks, triggering a one-day, $386 billion wipeout, when they realized they had badly miscalculated the scope of Narendra Modi’s election victory.
title: The Year of Elections Is Burning Investors From Mexico to India

description: Albanian protesters calling for Prime Minister Edi Rama to resign set tires ablaze and hurled stones at police after an Italian investigative report raised allegations about the premier’s involvement in organized crime and corruption.
title: Albania Protests Intensify Amid Calls on Prime Minister to Quit

description: Bill Hwang recently walked out of Wall Street’s trial of the decade to a flank of TV cameras. They were pointed in the other direction.
title: Bill Hwang, Bob Menendez and a $5 Salad: NY’s Courthouse Oscars

description: Traders are betting on more rand losses as the African National Congress leadership sets out to address the pressing issue of coalition-building after an election result that went against decades of precedent.
title: Bearish Rand Bets Rise as Ruling ANC Explores Coalition Options

description: President Joe Biden delivered a pointed rebuke to two men he’s identified as present-day threats to democracy — Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump — as he marked one of the US’s greatest triumphs against authoritarianism.
title: Biden Says Democracy at Risk in Ukraine Fight as He Marks D-Day

description: The US and its allies are raising the stakes in their struggle to curb ship attacks by Houthi militants in the Red Sea by increasingly blocking their revenue sources, a move that could jeopardize a peace deal intended to end an almost decade-long war in Yemen.
title: US Seeks to Up Pressure on Houthis in Threat to Yemen-War Truce

description: The Supreme Court of India on Thursday ordered neighboring states to increase water supply to the capital, to help ease the severe shortage due to a prolonged heat wave.
title: Indian Court Orders States to Share Water With Parched Capital

description: The US Treasury Department is seeking more information on how financial firms are using artificial intelligence, as well as opportunities and risks the technologies pose for the sector.
title: Biden Administration Seeks Input on How Wall Street Is Using AI

description: South Africa’s biggest labor union federation is pushing the ruling African National Congress to consider seeking support from the main opposition party to enable it to stay in power after it was stripped of its parliamentary majority, a person familiar with the situation said.
title: South African Unions Push ANC to Mull Arms-Length Deal With DA

description: China’s cabinet announced Thursday a plan to revamp the nation’s medical system, pledging reforms in areas from public hospitals to insurance payments.
title: China Pledges Key Reforms to Revamp Nation’s Medical System

description: Russian authorities said they detained a French citizen on suspicion of spying, the latest of several arrests of foreigners in the country since the start of the Kremlin’s war in Ukraine.
title: French Citizen Detained in Russia on Allegations of Spying

description: Claiming victory despite a massive electoral setback, Prime Minister Narendra Modi promised on Tuesday night to make India a key actor on the world stage on everything from trade to climate change. “A strong India will give strength to the world,” he said.
title: A Chastened Modi Could Be a More Reliable Partner to the US

description: A UK minister’s order to override a European Court of Human Rights ruling and send asylum seekers to Rwanda would be unlawful, lawyers argued at the latest challenge over the government’s controversial immigration policy.
title: Rwanda Policy Advice on Human Rights Court Unlawful, Union Says

description: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi posted his biggest electoral losses in states where his party made policy missteps and used divisive politics to win support, according to an analysis from Bloomberg Economics.
title: Modi Lost Big in States Where Divisive Politics Was Worse, Bloomberg Economics Analysis Shows

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Campaign Kicks Into Gear: Our Election Panel Reacts

description: President Joe Biden defended his decision to allow Ukraine to launch US-provided weapons against military targets within Russia, characterizing it as limited in scope amid worries it could spark a wider war.
title: Biden Defends Move to Let Ukraine Hit Russia With US Weapons

description: Neither Prime Minister Rishi Sunak nor his poll-leading Labour opponent Keir Starmer are fighting the UK election with a credible economic policy, and whoever wins will likely have to break their promises not to raise tax, according to analysis by Bloomberg Economics.
title: Tax Hikes Needed Whoever Wins UK Election, Analysis Shows

description: South Africa’s cabinet is set to undergo a major overhaul after the ruling party lost its parliamentary majority in last week’s elections, with seven serving ministers losing out on a seat.
title: South African Cabinet Shakeup Looms as Ministers Exit Parliament

description: India’s wildly inaccurate exit polls predicting a landslide election victory for Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party sparked dramatic public apologies from polling companies this week and calls for them to be investigated for possible manipulation.
title: India’s Exit Polls Spark Criticism, Tears and Call for Probes

description: NATO is planning to expand cooperation with Ukraine on defense technology and share more intelligence about Russia’s electronic warfare capabilities, as some of its members lift constraints on Kyiv’s ability to wage war.
title: NATO to Expand Defense Tech, Intelligence Sharing with Ukraine

description: Keir Starmer’s Labour Party maintains a 21.7-point lead over Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s governing Conservatives with exactly four weeks to go until UK election day.
title: Labour Maintains Lead Over Tories by 21.7 Points, Bloomberg Poll Composite Finds

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: D-Day Snub to Vladimir Putin Echoes Depths of Cold War

description: The African National Congress’s biggest decision-making body met to deliberate on how it will work with other South African political parties after last month’s elections failed to produce an outright winner, with President Cyril Ramaphosa expected to provide an update on the deliberations later.
title: ANC Leaders Meet to Weigh South Africa Options With Zuma Silent

description: At least 100 people have been killed by militants fighting for the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces in Sudan, rights groups and humanitarian officials said, amid a 14-month long civil war that’s created one of the world’s biggest humanitarian crises.
title: At Least 100 Killed in Attack on Sudanese Village Amid Civil War

description: The Hong Kong government is seeking to ban vaping and the use of other alternative smoking products in order to reduce smoking in the finance hub.
title: Hong Kong to Propose Ban on Vaping, New Curbs on Public Smoking

description: Vietnam’s parliament has tapped a new enforcer of its “blazing furnace” campaign against graft — promoting the current deputy of the public security ministry to become its head.
title: Vietnam Appoints New Enforcer of Its Anti-Corruption Campaign

description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak won’t attend an international gathering of world leaders during the D-Day ceremony in Normandy, missing the chance to represent the UK alongside US President Joe Biden and France’s Emmanuel Macron.
title: Sunak to Skip High-Profile D-Day Event with Biden, Macron

description: Welcome to the Year of the Elections, Bloomberg’s newsletter on the votes that matter to markets, business, and policy amid the most fragmented geo-economic landscape in decades.
title: Europe’s Far Right Advances, Fighting Itself

description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s Conservative Party accepted a further £5 million ($6.4 million) in donations from The Phoenix Partnership, the health care company run by controversial donor Frank Hester, according to the latest data released by the Electoral Commission on Wednesday.
title: Sunak’s Tories Get Further £5 Million From Donor in Racism Row

description: Olaf Scholz promised to send migrants who commit serious crimes back to their homelands, including Taliban-ruled Afghanistan and war-battered Syria, as the German chancellor responded to mounting concerns over law and order.
title: Scholz Vows to Fight Surge of Political ‘Terror’ in Germany

description: Israel is escalating warnings against Hezbollah in Lebanon by threatening it could be forced into a war with the Iran-backed group following increasingly deadly attacks.
title: Israel Ramps Up War Rhetoric as Hezbollah’s Attacks Raise Alarm

description: India’s new coalition government under Prime Minister Narendra Modi is the best election outcome for the world’s most-populous nation, Eurasia Group’s President Ian Bremmer said on Thursday, noting that a divided power structure will require more consensus-building.
title: India to Benefit From Coalition Checks on Modi, Eurasia Says

description: China’s President Xi Jinping has called for more exchanges between Chinese and American universities to boost mutual understanding, according to the official Xinhua News Agency.
title: Xi Calls for More University Exchanges With US to Boost Ties

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said he looks forward to closer ties with Taiwan in a social-media post responding directly to the island’s newly-elected president.
title: Modi Looks Forward to Closer Ties With Taiwan After Reelection

description: The Israeli military said it conducted an airstrike on a Hamas compound embedded in a school complex in Gaza that eliminated militants who took part in the deadly Oct. 7 attack against Israeli civilians.
title: Israel Says It Struck Hamas Facility Based at a School in Gaza

description: Tories have failed on their security strong suit, and the mess will be hard to fix.
title: ‘Global Britain’ Is Too Big for the UK’s Defense Britches

description: When it comes to schools, there is plenty for the next government to improve upon. But Conservatives’ focus on literacy and numeracy is paying dividends.
title: Education Is a Bright Spot in the Tories’ Record

description: Sun, wind and abundant land have attracted European investment in the southwestern African nation. But it’s unclear if the projects will ever be commercially viable.
title: Namibia’s Audacious Plan to Become a Global Green Hydrogen Hub

description: The attempted assassination of Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico last month is heightening tensions in the country ahead of EU parliamentary election
title: Fico Shooting Sharpens Slovak Political Divide Ahead of EU Vote

description: President Joe Biden will take on two men he’s identified as present-day threats to democracy — Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump — as he marks one of the US’s greatest triumphs against authoritarianism.
title: Biden Will Seize 80th D-Day Anniversary With Putin, Trump Rebuke

description: Donald Trump said Republican messaging around abortion restrictions has hurt the party, highlighting a liability that contributed to fewer-than-anticipated GOP wins in the 2022 midterm congressional elections and has the potential to be a drag in November.
title: Trump Says Republican Abortion Rhetoric Hurts His Party

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol said North Korea should feel a sense of shame after it sent balloons carrying trash across the border, as he stepped up pressure on Kim Jong Un’s regime.
title: South Korea Slams Kim’s Provocations, Including Trash Balloons

description: The US and 13 partner nations in Asia and the Pacific will sign agreements on two more parts of an economic pact key to Washington’s strategy to build clout in the region.
title: US Allies in Indo-Pacific to Sign Key Accords of Economic Pact

description: Vietnamese police seek to prosecute real estate tycoon Truong My Lan for alleged money laundering nearly two months after she was sentenced to death in a $12 billion fraud case, Tuoi Tre newspaper reported.
title: Vietnam Tycoon Sentenced to Death Faces Laundering Charge: Media
